reviews.review_msg: If you are willing to spend time thinking you will succeed. If you want a teacher that will give exams that are based on memorization of facts and numbers that you can just spit back out this isn't the instructor for you.
Martin is great. Great sense of humor and respect his students. Providing lecture recording which is must be listened for second time for a good grade. The grading is fair. Highly recommended.

Martin is very real in his lectures and doesn't sugar coat anything. He enjoys participation and will always play devils advocate. He makes you look at psychology, disorders/illnesses, and treatments in a while new light. Take if you want to expand your ideas. TA sucked, was rude, and graded poorly. Beware.

HIGHLY recommend this prof. Martin reminded me why I love psychology and his lectures are really interesting. He really makes you think, as opposed to just regurgitating info. No textbook so make sure you take good notes and understand the key ideas he's trying to get across. He does tend to digress but it's usually a funny or interesting story!

Amazing professor. Totally worth waking up for the morning classes. Respects students personal ideas over referencing. If you need some motivation back for school this is a Professor definitely worth taking a class with.  He can sometimes go off on a tangent but its usually interesting stuff. Beware of his TA. TOUGH MARKER!
Martin is a G. His lectures are really funny & interesting, doesnt use a textbook. The essay is fun and he is an easy marker. Would def take a class w/him again.
Take a class with him!  His class really helps you understand people, and he challenges assumptions in psychology and mental health, which makes for really interesting lectures.

Really great prof! lectures are recorded so if you miss one it's really helpful to go back and listen to the recording. No textbook for the class and the lecture slides are not super detailed. Make sure you listen and take notes. I missed classes and still did really well, but I took the time to listen to recordings to study for exams.
Awesome prof and easy class. I would definitely recommend taking PSYC106 with Martin if you have even a slight interest in psychology.

Inspirational, charming, and knowledgable prof! Martin's knowledge and humour keeps me awake at 9:30 on friday mornings. The criticisms he says in class makes a lot of sense when you digest it a little. He wants you to understand the info on a deeper level and requires u to put in your own thoughts! Overall, one of my fav class i took!

I really wish there was a tutorial for this class so that we can engage in the material more with him. But, Martin is a really knowledgeable guy from his experience in the field, tons of stories to tell that are relevant and it definitely makes me question my perception of mental illness. Grading is kind of unclear.
Thought provoking class by a wonderful prof.

Fantastic prof. His lectures are hilarious and interesting, and he has a down-to-earth personality. He also has a refreshingly critical perspective of his own field that's rare among other instructors. Emphasis on deeper understanding of concepts. One of the best courses I've taken so far, definitely recommend taking a course with him if you can.

He's a genuinely awesome guy. Super friendly and good at explaining the course content. The tutor marker, Sarah, doesn't attend lectures and his assignments were based on things learned from lecture and your own thoughts - the marking seemed unfair

no textbookreadings, entirely based on lec & slides. likes to "hide" infotrick those not in class (although it's nothing major), because he wants to reward those who comes to the 830 class. a bit quirky but very interesting & super hilarious. high expectations for students. very tricky exams. recommend listening to lec recordings & take notes!

Highlight of my semester. Some may not appreciate his teaching style as it's not clearcut facts to write down and memorize - you need to take good notes and understand it on a deeper level - but he does highlight what is importanttest material. Great discussion and different perspectives. Invest the timeopen your mind - so worth it!

Dr. Davidson doesn't have a focus in class. Class is just discussion about somewhat related topic. He did not cover any research on adolescent development. The tests consist of only essay questions which are very philosophical in nature. I do not recommend.

I really appreciated Martin's lecture style and his lived experiences and stories.  Made me remember why I decided upon studying psychology in the first place.  Listening to class lectures for a second time did not feel tedious at all, extremely interesting, human down-to-earth lecturer.  I will miss this class terribly.

I have never felt so inspired by a professor. He is funny, engaging, outspoken, genuine, and his stories will break your heart. It is easy to see how he is such an awesome therapist - he sees the best in everyone. Many students felt like crying on the last day. He is the opposite of condescending. Beware, his tests are not easy.

In response to the person below who thinks Daniella was a bad T.A., I had a totally different experience. She replied promptly to all my emails, was available for a very convenient scheduled time to meet and go over my exam with me and gave me so many helpful tips which helped me ace the class. She was a great T.A., and Martin was a brilliant prof.
Great guy, great class.
HE IS AMAZING. Honestly such a great, smart man. Makes you look at Psychology in a way you never have. So sad this class is over.

Martin has become my favourite prof at SFU. So insightful and approachable. So relatable to students and really makes you think. He values critical thinking and skepticism over many issues in psychology, rare in a a psychology professor today. He isn't the "memorize & repeat" guy. If you have a chance to take his classes, please do it.

Don't take his lecture unless u think u are an effective learner in the lecture room. No reading, sounds sweet... but the truth was that u have no pathway to follow.. his lectures might be fun... but i found it just "too fun" to be a lecture... all i remember in classes were jokes and jokes..

Martin is truly hilarious and he really cares about the students but he is serious about the material! You have to really dig deep to do well on the exams as the MC can be confusing a lot of the time. What I love about Martin is that he is a practicing psychologist so we get real-world examples of what we talk about in class, which I love a lot.

Like many others stated, it's not always clear what he expects for the exams and assignment, so yeah, you need to actually study and know your stuff. At the same time he doesn't just want you to memorize and regurgitate, he's trying to get us to THINK. His lectures are AMAZING!

Martin is 100% amazing. He is like no other psych prof- he is honest, hilarious, and engaging. He ACTUALLY CARES about teaching! You definitely cannot miss a class (no textbook) and make sure to write good notes because his tests are tough- the questions really challenge your knowledge and comprehension. If you can take a course with him, DO IT!

He is a great professor, he is extremely knowledgable, funny, personable and funny. However, the laid-back class that gives you a different ever-last perspective on Psyc comes with difficult tests and ambiguous paper assignments. I have taken both his adolescent development class and intro to psychopathology. Not easy but no memorizing!

LOVE his lecture! It was a 8:30am lecture but you won't fall asleep because he is SUPER HILARIOUS! He loves to talk about the stories from his clinical profession background. Must attend lecture because he likes to turn off his mic when it comes to sensitive  controversial topics (you dont wanna miss that cuz usually he got a point).
Best prof I've ever had. So insightful and hilarious. Could listen to him talk all day oh my goodness.

He was amazing! Material was very interesting and he was clearly passionate about it. Tests were harder than you'd expect, based on his joking personality during lectures, but never unfair. Always open to questions.

Knows his stuff very well. Very real professor and not afraid to talk about the problems in the profession.  Do not be disarmed by his easy going nature because he expects a lot from his students.  He requires you synthesize material not just memorize.

I was on the fence about doing counselling but his views made me realize that there is no better field. He was SO amazing and I learnt so much from him. 356 was an easier, more structured class, but 355 was just as good. I wish he would teach more Psyc courses...he was hilarious and very insightful and I actually looked forward to the 8:30 classes.
Exams are essays and short answers which is lots of writing and hard to get marks. The outline of paper is broad and difficult to know what the prof wants.

Such a wasted opportunity,I was excited for the next instalment of the developmental process&instead was subjected to his verbal vomit, unclear, nonchalant teaching style&outrageous marking scheme. Don't tell us to be creative with the course material then make a structured rubric for marking. Probs a great therapist but I want a prof not a BFF.
LIKES: encourages critical thinking, engaging, smart. DISLIKES: goes off tangent, his jokes/laid back style distracts from his teaching so it's hard to take him srsly sometimes. hard marking scheme!

He's kinda like the equivalent of the 'diary of a wimpy kid' books for preteens. Like they're funny and entraining but you really don't learn anything. Like a way to get kids interesting in reading. But if you already like reading it really doesn't do much for you.
This guy is great! Funny, interesting material, and well worth rocking up to the 8.30 lectures!!

Martin is AWESOME! Cannot rate him highly enough! He is not your typical dry prof, is funny, and I learnt a lot. There is a bit of lack of structure to his lectures, which i know others don't necessarily like and he talks super fast. I did well in the exams. My tip is to take very good notes. He gives every opportunity for you to do well!!!

He is a chilling prof but many times we go off topic in discussions. It gets confusing as to what is on the exam and what is not. Expects too much when explanations are too confusing (they go all over the place). Exams are NOT easy
dope teacher. enjoyed going to class and he is a total bro, recommend taking whatever class he teaches. really gets you thinking about stuff. thanks for a great year man

Every lecture was, "Maxwell House Coffee Time: Good 'til the last drop" (something he stole from a teacher of his). Listen to his lectures, b/c they're not only entertaining, but a refreshing look into psychology.
Best Prof!

I thought he was great! Very entertaining lectures, and he's hot (in a nerdy kinda way!) It was not mandatory to attend lectures as they were recorded but It's more fun if you go. Best prof in the Psyc department hands down!
A dash of intellectual brilliance. The class lectures were riveting despite an 8:30am start.

His lectures were interesting because he uses lots of examples, but the exam was fairly unreasonable. Most of the questions were extremely similar so you have to think extra hard. Memorizing the material from lecture will definitely not get you anywhere

A great professor who strives to move past the memorization/regurgitation method of doing exams. Attending lectures is half the battle to passing the course. Very approachable and brings real life applications forward in explaining the materials. If you don't mind using your brain to think this is a good instructor to take classes with.

Professor is fun and humorous, but there were major discrepancies between what was taught and what was expected in the midterm. 155 people out of 237 received 62% or less on the multiple choice. Also, people are encouraged to voice concerns or opinions but then are allowed to be attacked or invalidated by other classmates.
Is a fun teacher but there were discrepancies between the lecture and the exam.

Martin is great ! He is very approachable and relatable. He sends very interesting/informative emails frequently to his students. In class he gets across the most important points of the course and adds in his own personal view on things, which were mostly always outside the box. I would recommend going to lectures but not getting the text.

Awesome professor! He's clearly into his lecture and puts a genuine effort into trying to make people feel welcomed. His examples used in-class helped a great deal with remembering concepts taught in class. He even took the time to explain to me the rules of chess after I blurted out I didn't know how the game worked...oh yeah he played chess.

Martin is awesome. Super funny and helpful. if its not on the lecture slides, it wont be on the exams. so no need to read the texbook. still, study hard and you'll get a good grade. exams are M/C with short answer questions given to you ahead of time. Take his class if you can! TAs mark you paper, so talk to them before hand.
He is the funniest prof i have ever had! very comfortable with student, does not take him self seriously... He is perfect. midterm and final were fair overall.

Best prof Ive had at sfu. Hilarious yet informative. Random swear words throughout lecture were endearing. Attending lectures were always a treat. His exams are pretty fair as well. He's all about the human experience rather than over intellectualizing. Obviously cares about his clients and his students.
Martin is the most laid back prof I've ever had. I really enjoyed his teaching style. His exams and assignments were fair. His use of humor made the course fun. I would recommend taking his class.
such a nice professor and make the class so interesting!!!!

Martin is a wonderful prof! His lectures were recorded, but attending them were definitely fun. He encouraged questions and class discussions and made an effort to make them engaging and interesting. Exams were MC + written. 4 Essay topics were given before the exam, and 2 of which will be chosen. One of my most enjoyable courses at SFU
